One hundred and thirtythree years of editorial freedom

Addressing a sometimes hostile crowd American Civil Rights Coalition Chairman Ward Connerly  announced the launch of a campaign to bring a voter initiative to Michigan to end preferences based on race PERIOD

I am pleased to join others to announce that we the people hereby assembled will  begin a campaign to  place on the November  ballot what will be commonly known as the Michigan Civil Rights Act Connerly said today on the Diag PERIOD

The event was hosted by The Michigan Review who introduced  Connerly  as a true leader in the fight for civil rights in America. during his speech Connerly said the Supreme Courts recent ruling on the Universitys admissions policies is a violation of the Equal Protection Clause of the fourteenth Amendment and the  Civil Rights Act PERIOD

Connerly said his group plans to start local organization of the campaign including recruiting volunteer and paid staff developing a fundraising campaign and recruiting local support PERIOD He said the signature gathering process will begin on September  and will be concluded by early next year PERIOD

He also said his group would attempt to launch the initiative in other states PERIOD
Our crusade will not end with the state of Michigan Connerly said PERIOD

Connerlys speech was followed by remarks from several supporters including Jennifer Gratz and Barbara Grutter plaintiffs in the recent lawsuits against the University PERIOD

Protesters including members of The Coalition to Defend Affirmative Action and Integration and Fight for Equality By Any Means Necessary held signs and sang chants to express their opposition to Connerlys views PERIOD

Two BAMN members were led away from the event by Department of Public Safety officials after having been warned twice to cease their chanting during the speeches PERIOD
